titleStmt.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the second half of the year)

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: I) The Sǝnkǝssar for the second half of the year (fols. 3ra-164vc) I-1) Maggābit (fols. 3ra–29rb) I-2) Miyāzyā (fols. 30ra–49vc) I-3) Gǝnbot (fols. 50ra–75vc) I-4) Sane (fols. 76ra–100rc) I-5) Ḥamle (fols. 101ra–134vc) I-6) Naḥāse (fols. 135ra–160rb) I-7) Ṗagʷǝmen (fols. 160rb–164vc) The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns Additiones 1-16; colophon.

msItem.title: Sǝnkǝssār “Synaxarion” for the second half of the year
msItem.note: The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns

msItem.explicit: ለዘአጽሐፍዎ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ወብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወለዘጸሐፎ፡ ዘክርስቶስ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይክፍሎሙ፡ ማኅደረ፡ ውስተ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ምስለ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወሰማዕት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወበሉ፡ ሎሙ፡ አቡነ፡ ዘበሰማያት፡ As to the commissioners Gabrʾel and Bǝʾse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer, and to the scribe Zakrǝstos, may God reward them a place in the Kingdom of Heaven with the righteous and the martyrs, forever and ever Amen. You may recite for them Pater Noster.

49vcለዘጸሐፎ፡ ሠርፀ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወለዘአጽሐፎ፡ አቡነ፡ ዘሥላሴ፡ ኅቡረ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ወይረሲ፡ ማኅደሮሙ፡ ምስለጻድቃን፡ ወሰማዕት፡ አሜን።The scribe Śarḍa Mikāʾel and the commissioner ʾabuna Zäśǝllāse, may God forgive them together in the kingdom of heaven and may He make their dwelling with the righteous and martyrs, Amen.

msItem.colophon: 164vcተፈጸመ᎓ መጽሐፈ᎓ ስንክሳር᎓ ለእግዚአብሔር᎓ በሥምረቱ᎓ እንዘ᎓ ይረድአነ᎓ በክሂሎቱ። ስብሐት᎓ ሎቱ። እስመ᎓ ተለዓለ᎓ ስሙ᎓ ለባሕቲቱ። በ፸፻᎓፩፻᎓፵᎓ወ፬᎓ ዓመተ᎓ ምሕረት᎓ እንዘ᎓ ዓበቅቴ᎓ ፲ወ፰። መጥቅዕሂ᎓ ፲ወ፪᎓ ጥንትዮን᎓ ፬ በሳድሳይ᎓ ወርኅ᎓ ለፀሐይ᎓ ጊዜ᎓ ሥርቀቱ። ለሳብዕ᎓ ወረኅ᎓ እምቅድመ᎓ ግብአቱ᎓ እም፯ሠርቀ᎓ ሌሊት᎓ አመ፲ወ፭᎓ ለየካቲት᎓ ሠርቀ᎓ መዓልት᎓ ለንጉሥነ᎓ ፋሲለደስ᎓ በ፲ወ፱᎓ ዓመተ᎓ መንግሥቱ᎓ ጳጳስሂ᎓ አባ᎓ ሚካኤል᎓ ወመምህርሂ᎓ አባ᎓ ዘሥላሴ᎓ ወቀይሰ᎓ ገበዝሂ᎓ ብእሴ᎓ እግዚአብሔር᎓ ወሱታፌሆሙ᎓ ገብርኤል᎓ ለዘጸሐፎ᎓ ዘወልደ᎓ ማርያም᎓ ወለዘአጽሐፎ᎓ ለዘ᎓ አንበቦ᎓ ወለዘተርጐሞ᎓ ወለዘሰምዓ᎓ ቃላቲሁ᎓ ይጽሐፍ᎓ ስሞሙ᎓ ኀበ᎓ ዓምደ᎓ ወርቅ᎓ በቀለመ᎓ ጽድቅ። ክርስቶስ᎓ ሊቅ᎓ አመ᎓ ይመጽእ᎓ በንጥረ᎓ መባርቅት᎓ ወድልቅል[ቅ]᎓ ወተፍጻሜቱኒ᎓ ኮነ᎓ በዕለተ᎓ ሠሉስ᎓ በ፯ሰዓት።The book of Synaxarion has been completed with the will of God, while He assists us with His might. May praise be to Him, because only His name is superior. In 7144 A.M. while ʿabaqte is 18, maṭqǝ 12, ṭǝntyon 4, on the 6th month during the rise of the sun. Before the commencement of the 7th month, from the 7th śarqa lelit, on the 15th of Yakkātit śarqa maʿālt, on the 19th year of reign of our king Fāsiladas. The metropolitan ʾabbā Mikāʾel, and the mamhǝr ʾabbā ZaŚǝllāse, and the qaysa gabaz Bǝʾse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer and their companion Gabrǝʾel. To Zawalda Māryām, one who wrote it, to one who made it written, to one who red it, to one who translated it, to one who listened its words may write their names on a pillar of Gold by an ink of righteousness. When Christ, the chief, comes with flash of lightning and trembling, the end becomes on the day of Tuesday at the seventh hour.

supportDesc.extent: Made of 165.0 folios, of which 3.0 blank 1v, 2v, 29v,, in 20.0 quires (A+19). 395 345 90
supportDesc.foliation: Foliated by the Ethio-SPaRe team. Lacuna: 29rb, 29rc, 49vb, 49vc, 100va, 100vb, 100vc

9 ፳፭III(9; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2; 8, stub after 1/fols. 21r-29v)
8 ፳፰VI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6 stub after 3/fols. 50r-57v)
8 ፴፪X(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 84r-91v)
7 ፵፩XIX(7; s.l.: 4, stub before 2; 5, stub before 2; 6, stub after 1/fols. 159r-165v).

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: Fine Black, red (vivid scarlet) Scribe Zakrǝstos copied the section for Maggābit (quires I-III); his name is written in the bottom margin of 3r and in the supplication on f. 29rb. Mid-17th century Divine names; names of donors and scribes; some lines in the incipit page, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each section; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; the word salām (e.g., fols. 3rc, 8rb, 10rb).

Fine Black, red (vivid scarlet) Scribe Śarḍa Mikāʾel copied the section for Miyāzyā (quires IV-V); his name is written in the bottom margin of 30r, supplication on f. 49vc and in Addition 1. Mid-17th century Divine names; names of donors and scribes; some lines in the incipit page, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each section; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

Fine Black, red (vivid scarlet) Scribe Yamāna Krǝstos copied the section for Gǝnbot (quires VI-VIII); his name is written in the bottom margin of 50r. Mid-17th century Divine names; names of donors and scribes; some lines in the incipit page, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each section; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

Fine Black, red (vivid scarlet) Ṣaggā Krǝstos copied the section for Ḥamle (quires XII-XV); his name is written in the bottom margin of 101r Mid-17th century Divine names; names of donors and scribes; some lines in the incipit page, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each section; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

Fine Black, red (vivid scarlet) Scribe Zawalda Māryām is mentioned in the colophon. Mid-17th century Divine names; names of donors and scribes; some lines in the incipit page, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each section; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

item.desc: Scribe’s signature (?)
item.q: መምረይ᎓ ገብረ᎓ ጻድቅ᎓ እቃቤት። ዛቲ᎓ መጽሐፍ᎓ ዘጸሐፍዋ᎓ ሰርጸ᎓ ሚካኤል᎓ አሜንጴ᎓ መምህርነ᎓ ዘዮሐንስ ይባርክ᎓ አሜን᎓ ለይኩን። Mamǝray Gabra Ṣādǝq is (head of) store. This book is written by Sarṣa Mikāʾel ʾAmenṗe(?). May our teacher Zayoḥannǝs bless, Amen, so be it.

item.locus: f. 3v (upper margin of the reading for Maggābit 2)
item.desc: Commemorative notice on Bǝʾse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer.
item.q: ወበዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ካዕበ፡ ተዝካረ፡ ዕረፍቱ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በረከተ፡ አምላኩ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

item.locus: f. 26r (upper margin of the reading for Maggābit 27)
item.desc: Commemorative notice on Ǝḫǝta Krǝstos
item.q: ወበዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ አዕረፈት፡ እኅተ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዓመተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሠናይት፡ ግዕዝ፡ መፍቄሪተ፡ አኃው፡ አምሳለ፡ ፌቤን፡ ተለአኪተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁራ፡ ብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡

item.desc: Commemorative notice on ʾabbā Zaʾaḥādu, head of Dabra Dāmmo
item.q: ወበዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ካዕበ፡ አዕረፈ፡ አባ፡ ዘአሐዱ፡ አምላክ፡ መምህር፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ ተጋዳሊ፡ ትሩፍ፡ ዘአስረፀ፡ ክንፈ፡ ከመ፡ ዖፍ፡ ለተወርዎ፡ ጸድፍ። ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር። ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም

item.locus: f. 55v (upper margin of the reading on Gǝnbot 10)
item.desc: Commemorative notice on ʾabbā Yoḥānni
item.q: ወበዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ካዕበ፡ ተዝካሩ፡ ለአባ፡ ዮሐኒ፡ መነኮስ፡ ትሩፍ፡ መስተጋድል፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፤ ውእቱ፡ አቡሆሙ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፤ ወለአባ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ሞአ፡ ዘሐይቅ። ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስሌነ።

item.desc: : Commemorative notice on ʾabbā Ǝsṭifanos.
item.q: ወበዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ካዕበ፡ አዕረፉ፡ አባ፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡ ወመርዐተ፡ አብ፡ ሱቱፋነ፡ ምግባር፡ ወግእዝ፡ ትሩፋን፡ መስተጋድላን፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ወበረከቶሙ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሮሙ፡ ብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

item.desc: Commemorative notice on abbā Tawalda Madḫǝn, hermit and monk.
Commemorative notice on ʾabuna Tarbinos.
Commemorative notice on Queen Māryām Kǝbra, the wife of King Nāʿod (r. 1494-1508).
item.q: ወበዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ካዕበ፡ አዕረፈት፡ ማርያም፡ ክብራ፡ ንግሥት፡ ብእሲተ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ናኦድ፡ ዘዓቀበት፡ ምግባራተ፡ መንፈሳዌ፤ ወፈጸመት፡ ኵሎ፡ ትሩፋተ፡ ወተጋድሎተ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ወፈጸመት፡ ቀኖና፡ መነኮሳት፡ ቅድሳት፡ በደብረ፡ ሊባኖስ፤ ዘይእቲ፡ መቃብረ፡ አቡነ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ረድኤተ፡ ትንብልናሃ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

item.desc: Commemorative notice on ʾabbā ZaŚǝllāse, head of Dabra Dāmmo.
item.q: ወካዕበ፡ በዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ አዕረፈ፡ አባ፡ ዘሥላሴ፡ መምህር፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ መስተጋድል፡ ትሩፍ፡ ወዕረፍቱኒ፡ ኮነ፡ በገዳመ፡ ዋሊ፡ በእደ፡ ጋላተ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ አረሚ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ ወዕሤተ፡ ስምዑ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔ፡ ር ወምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

item.desc: Commemorative notice on ʾabuna Zawalda Māryām
item.q: ወካዕበ፡ በዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ አቡነ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ በገዳመ፡ ዋሊ፡ ድኅረ፡ ተጋደለ፡ ሠናየ፡ ገድለ፡ በከመ፡ ተምህረ፡ እም፡ አረጋዊ፡ አቡሁ፡ እስከ፡ ያነክሩ፡ አኃዊሁ፡ እምትሩፋቲሁ። ወትሩፋቲሁኒ፡ ኮነ፡ ይገብር፡ ቆብዓ፡ ዘሐፂን፡ ክቡደ፤ ዓዲ፡ ኮነ፡ ይትቀሰፍ፡ በነደ፡ እሳት፡ ዘሐፂን፡ እስከ፡ ይፀይእ፡ ወይወጽእ፡ ዕፄ፡ እምሥጋሁ፤ ዓዲ፡ ኮነ፡ ይከሪ፡ ግበ፡ መጠነ፡ ቆሙ፡ ወይበውእ፡ ውስቴቱ፡ እስከ፡ ይትሌለይ፡ ማዕሰ፡ ሥጋሁ፡ እምብዝኃ፡ ዋዕይ። ዓዲ፡ ኮነት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ትትናገሮ፡ በቃላ፡ ጥዑም፡ በውሣጤ፡ ሥዕላ፡ እምዝኃ፡ ንጽህናሁ፡ ወአፍቅሮቱ፡ ኪያሃ፡ ናዛዚተ፤ በጊዜ፡ መከራ። ባሕቱ፡ ኢጸሐፍነ፡ ኵሎ፡ ገድሉ፡ ከመ፡ ኢናብዝኅ፡ ነገረ፡ እስመ፡ ዝንቱ፡ የዓክለነ፡ ለሰማዕያን። እግዚአብሔር፡ ይምሐረነ፡ በጸሎቱ፡ ለኵልነ፡ ሰማዕያን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም።

item.desc: Qǝne-poem by Galāwdewos of ʾAksum (ʾAxumite), of mawaddǝs type.
item.q: መወድስ᎓ ዘገላውዴዎስ᎓ አክሱማዊ᎓ በሀኪ᎓ ቤቴል፤ ደብረ᎓ ሰላምነ፤ ወኆኅተ᎓ ሰማይ ርኁት፤ ነገረ᎓ ቃለ᎓ ምክር᎓ መንፈሳዊ፤ በሰዓተ᎓ ሕልሙ᎓ [ቀ]ኖ[ና]፤ ምግባረ᎓ ንውም᎓ ባሕታዊ፤ እንተ᎓ ነጸርኪ፤ ወሬዛ᎓ ጻማዊ፤ ያዕቆብ᎓ አረጋዊ፤ ወአቀመ᎓ ብኪ᎓ ሐውልተ᎓ ኪዳኑ᎓ አርያማዊ፤ ይኩን᎓ ለዘሀለዎ፤ ምጽአተ᎓ መድኃኒት᎓ ናዝራዊ፤ ትእምርተ᎓ ነገር᎓ ፍኖተ᎓ ጽድቅ፤ ድሉተ ተሀልዊ፤ እንዘ᎓ ይኤምኀኪ᎓ አፈ፤ አፈ᎓ ቊልዔኪ᎓ ዕብራዊ፤ ነዋ᎓ ይብለኪ᎓ ቅድመ᎓ እሉ፤ አእላፈ᎓ ያሬድ᎓ ማኅሌታዊ፤

desc.title: Za-ʾaqrabku māḥleta… “The song I am offering…”

item.q: ዘአቅረብኩ᎓ ማኅሌተ᎓ አዘኪርየ᎓ አዕላፈ᎓ እምእለ᎓ ተጸምዱከ᎓ ዘልፈ። ለለአነብብ᎓ ተወከፍ᎓ ዘንዴትየ᎓ መጽሐፈ᎓ እንተ᎓ ረሰይከ᎓ እግዚኦ᎓ ጸሪቀ᎓ መበለት᎓ ውኩፈ። እምእለ᎓ አብዑ᎓ ብዑላን᎓ ተርፈ። ነቢያት᎓ ቅዱሳን᎓ ወሐዋርያት᎓ ሰባክያን᎓ ሰማዕት᎓ ወጻድቃን᎓ ወመላዕክት᎓ ትጉሃን᎓ ደናግል᎓ ዓዲ᎓ ወመነኮሳት᎓ ኄራን᎓ ባርኩ᎓ ባርኩ᎓ ጉባዔ᎓ ዛቲ᎓ መካን᎓ እስከ᎓ አረጋዊ᎓ ልሂቅ᎓ እምንዑስ᎓ ሕፃን᎓ ለዘጸሐፎ᎓ በክርታስ᎓ ወለዘአጽሐፎ᎓ እንዘ᎓ ይደርስ። ለዘአንበቦ᎓ ወለዘተርጐሞ᎓ በልሳን᎓ ሐዲስ᎓ በጸሎተ᎓ እሙ᎓ ማርያም᎓ ዓራቂተ᎓ ኵሉ᎓ እምባእስ᎓ ኅቡረ᎓ ይምሐረነ᎓ ኢየሱስ᎓ ክርስቶስ።

item.desc: Qǝne-poem by Yoḥannǝs, of mawaddǝs type.
item.q: መወድስ᎓ ዘዮሐንስ᎓ ታስቈቁ᎓ ጥቀ᎓ ሰቃቅወ᎓ ልብ᎓ ወተናዝዞ᎓ ተዓቢ᎓ መቅደስ᎓ ዳሞ᎓ ራሔል፤ እስከነ᎓ ተሰምዖ᎓ ተሰምዐ᎓ መልዕልተ᎓ ራማ᎓ ልዑል፤ ጽራሃ᎓ ብካያ᎓ ዘበአፍ᎓ ወቃል፤ ለአባግዒሃ᎓ ሕዝበ᎓ ወንጌል፤ ወመርዔተ᎓ ቤታ᎓ ገነት᎓ ጽጉያነ᎓ ምግባር᎓ እምጽጌ᎓ ኮል፤ ውስቴታ᎓ ዘይርዕዮሙ᎓ በኂርውና᎓ ወሣህል፤ እስመ᎓ ኀጥአት᎓ በኀሢሥ᎓ እምጽንፍ᎓ ወእማእከል፤ ባሕቱ᎓ ኖላዌ᎓ ትጉሐ᎓ ዓቂቦቶሙ᎓ ዘይክል፤ ሢም᎓ ሎሙ᎓ ዘከማከ᎓ መክብበ᎓ ኖሎት᎓ ዘሚካኤል፤ ቅድመ᎓ ይምሥጥዎሙ᎓ ግብተ᎓ ተኵላተ᎓ ሙስና᎓ ወሐጕል፤ ሢም᎓ ሎሙ᎓ ዘከማከ᎓ መክብበ᎓ ኖሎት᎓ ዘሚካኤል፤
item.note: The composer of the Qǝne tells that Dabra Dāmmo is “crying” (ls 1-4) because it could not find a good “shepherd” who would protects its people (ls 5-9); So that asks St Michael to appoint one before it is late (ls 10-11).

item.desc: Qǝne-poem, of kǝbr yǝʾǝti and ʿǝṭāna mogar type.
item.q: ክብር᎓ ይእቲ᎓ እግዚአብሔር᎓ ሥመር᎓ በሥምረትከ᎓ ሥምርት፤ እስከነ ትጸጊ᎓ ለከ᎓ ጽጌያተ᎓ ትሩፍ᎓ ስብሐት፤ ይሥቅይዋ᎓ ዘልፈ᎓ ለመቅደሰ᎓ ዳሞ᎓ ገነት፤ ትፍሥሕት᎓ ጤግሮስ᎓ ወዔፍራጥስ᎓ ኃሤት፤ ዕጣነ᎓ ሞገር ለመንግሥተ᎓ ሰማይ᎓ ገነት᎓ ዘመዓድም᎓ ጽ[ጌሃ]፤ ወጥዑማነ᎓ ጣዕም᎓ ጥቀ᎓ ፍሬያቲሃ፤ አስራበ᎓ ማየ᎓ ክብር᎓ ወስብሐት᎓ እስመ᎓ ይሰቅዩ᎓ ማእከሌሃ፤ ይትዋረስ᎓ ርሥተ᎓ [ቅድሳቲሃ]፤ ገብር᎓ ኄር᎓ አረጋዊ᎓ ምናናተ᎓ ምግባር᎓ አብዝኀ፤ ወመክሊተ᎓ ገድል᎓ ፈድፋደ᎓ አርብሐ፤ ለመቅደሰ᎓ ዳሞ᎓ መርዓት᎓ ባሕቱ᎓ አምጣነ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ መርዓዊሃ፤ ለለ᎓ ሠርቀ᎓ ዕለት᎓ ይስክብ᎓ እንበለ᎓ ተፈልጦ᎓ ምስሌሃ፤ እስከ᎓ አመ᎓ ይትወለድ᎓ እምኔሃ፤ ኖላዌ᎓ መርዔት᎓ ወልድ᎓ በኵረ᎓ ፍሥሐ፤ እምልብነ᎓ ዘያረስእ᎓ ላሓ፤
item.note: The composer tried to tell in his Qǝne, the need for a new abbot (not clear whether a substitute or a replacement) for Dabra Dāmmo. In lines 8-10, he said ‘May Abuna ʾAragāwi sleep every day with his bride Dabra Damo until she gives birth to a new shepherd’.

list.item: f. 165v Qǝne-poem, of kǝbr yǝʾǝti and ʿǝṭāna mogar type. ክብር᎓ ይእቲ እግዚአብሔር᎓ አምላክ᎓ ፈጣሬ᎓ ዓለማት᎓ መንታ፤ ደቂቀ᎓ ዛቲ᎓ መቅደስ᎓ ኢይኩኑ᎓ እጓለ᎓ ማውታ፤ ጸግዎሙ᎓ አበ᎓ ሠናየ᎓ ግዕዝ᎓ ወጾታ፤ መዝሙረ᎓ ስብሐት᎓ ዘይዜምር᎓ ምስለ᎓ ብእሴ᎓ ሰላም᎓ ውስቴታ፤ ዕጣነ᎓ ሞገር ለእመ᎓ ፈጣሪ᎓ ድንግል᎓ እንተ᎓ እምፍጡራን᎓ ሐረያ፤ መጽሐፈ᎓ ተአምር᎓ ይነግር᎓ ዜና᎓ ዕበያ፤ በቀለመ᎓ ስብሐት᎓ እስመ᎓ አጽሐፍከ᎓ ወአንበብከ᎓ በሃሌ᎓ ሉያ፤ እስከ᎓ ትፌውሳ᎓ ወታጥዕያ፤ ለሕምምተ᎓ ነፍስት᎓ ዳሞ᎓ ዘደዌ᎓ ተሀውኮ᎓ አድወያ፤ በፈውሰ᎓ ኅድአት᎓ ወጽምው᎓ አርአያ፤ ብእሴ᎓ እግዚአብሔር᎓ ምእመን᎓ ኤጲስ᎓ ቆጶስ᎓ ሱታፌ᎓ ደቅስዮስ᎓ ዘጥልጥልያ፤ መንበረ᎓ [ጻማ?]᎓ [ኀይለ?]᎓ ክብር᎓ ተሀብከ᎓ ዘኢተኬነዎ᎓ ኬንያ፤ ወታልብስከ᎓ ካዕበ᎓ ልብ᎓ሰ ላሕያ፤ ቅድመ᎓ ሰብአ᎓ ግብጽ᎓ ኵሎሙ᎓ ወኢትዮጵያ፤ በጽዋዔ᎓ ስመከ᎓ ሰምያ፤ The composer of the Qǝne pleads God to end the unrest in Dabra Dāmmo (ls. 4-5), in which qaysa gabaz Bǝʾse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer (s. the colophon) was very tolerant (ls. 6-7).

item.desc: salām-hymn to St Mary.
One line note on St Lālibalā.
A note on the inauguration of the church of Dabra Dāmmo.
salām-hymn to ʾabbā Zawalda Māryām.
A note mentioning ʾabbā Gabra Ṣādǝq as the head of store house.
The title of the book and the internal number of monastic library (326) is written in black paint on 1r.
Pen trial on 2r.
Writing excersises on 2r
A full line is erased on fol 24ra.
Parchment cuts crudely repaired on 56.
Tamallas-sign on 62rc indicating the place wherethe omission at the upper margin, belongs.
Five lines are erased on 74a and c.
Tamallas-sign on 87ra indicating the place where the salām-hymn on St Lalibäla at the upper margin, belongs.

Names of the scribes, Zakrǝstos and Śarḍa Mikāʾel, are written at the bottom of the Ms. on fols 3r, 30r. Other two unidentified names, Yamāna Krǝstos and Ṣaggā Krǝstos are also given the same style like the scribes on 50r, 101r.
A correction made interlineally on 143rc.
Pen trial notes, one mentioning Wednesday on 165v.
Shelfmark C3-IV-261 on fol. 3

- Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margins in each quire: Maggābit (fols. 3r, 13r, 21r) Miyāzyā (fosl. 30r, 40r) Gǝnbot (fols. 50r, 58r, 66r) Sane (fols. 76r, 84r, 92r) Ḥamle (fols. 101r, 109r, 117r, 125r) Naḥāse (fols. 135r, 143r, 151r, 159r) Ṗāgʷǝmen (fols. )

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two rows of endband stitches through the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: straight triple line fillet, double circle, zig-zag, romb form, X-form).

origin.origDate: On the 19th year of reign of King Fāsiladas (r. 1632-67) (s. colophon).

history.provenance: Three persons are mentioned throughout the Ms. as commissioners, Bǝʾse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer (e.g., Additio 4; his death is mentioned in Additio 2), his son Gabrʾel (e.g., Additio 4), and ʾabuna ZaŚǝllāse (see colophon and the supplication on 49vc).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
adjusted to schema, no person mark up carried out
